sen.j: 山名 義幸（やまな よしゆき、生没年不詳）は南北朝時代 (日本)の守護大名。
sen.e: Yoshiyuki YAMANA (date of birth and death unknown) is a shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 義幸は山名師義の長子として生まれ、永和 (日本)元年（1375年）に丹波国守護となった。
sen.e: Yoshiyuki was born as the eldest child of Moroyoshi YAMANA and became Shugo of Tanba no kuni in 1375.

sen.j: 翌永和2年（1376年）、父の師義が死去すると病弱であることを理由に家督の継承を辞退した。
sen.e: When his father Moroyoshi died in 1376, he refrained to succeed the family estate because he was feeble.

sen.e: In 1379, he was appointed to be Shugo of Izumo Province and Oki Province after Takahide SASAKI fell; as a result he became Shugo of three provinces including Tanba.
